cards.title: Probability Density Functions (PDF) and Cumulative Distribution Functions (CDF)
details: Work with probability density functions, possibly defined piecewise
Understand and use the relationship between PDF and CDF
Evaluate probabilities and percentiles using PDF or CDF

cards.title: Expectations and Related Variables
details: Use expectation formulas with continuous distributions
Use CDFs of related variables in simple cases

cards.title: Hypothesis Testing with Small Samples
details: Formulate and test hypotheses concerning population means using t-tests
Select and apply two-sample and paired t-tests or normal tests as appropriate

cards.title: Confidence Intervals
details: Determine confidence intervals for means and mean differences using t or normal distributions

cards.title: Goodness of Fit
details: Fit theoretical distributions to data as prescribed by a hypothesis
Use chi-squared tests for goodness of fit

cards.title: Contingency Tables
details: Use chi-squared tests for independence in contingency tables

cards.title: Principles and Applications
details: Understand the idea and utility of non-parametric tests
Understand and use sign test, Wilcoxon signed-rank test, and Wilcoxon rank-sum test

cards.title: Application to Median and Population Identity
details: Apply single-sample and paired-sample non-parametric tests

cards.title: Definition and Calculation
details: Understand and construct probability generating functions (PGFs) for discrete distributions
Use the PGF for mean and variance calculations

cards.title: PGFs and Sums of Variables
details: Use the property that the PGF of the sum of independent random variables is the product of their PGFs
